pages.text: One bright morning, <name> skipped through the garden, humming a happy tune. The sun was shining, the flowers were swaying, and everything felt just right. Suddenly, she spotted something sparkling in the grass. It was a tiny key that shimmered with all the colors of the rainbow. Curious and excited, <name> picked it up and wondered what it could unlock.

She decided to follow the rainbow light that glowed softly from the key. It led her into the woods, where the trees whispered as if sharing secrets. Soon, she found a small wooden door hidden in the trunk of a giant oak tree. The rainbow key fit perfectly into the lock, and with a soft click, the door opened to reveal a magical world full of floating lanterns, talking animals, and sparkling rivers.

As <name> stepped inside, she met a friendly squirrel named Pip. Pip explained that the lanterns had stopped glowing because the Rainbow Key had been lost. Without the lanterns, the forest felt dim and quiet. <name> realized the key she had found was the answer. With Pip’s help, she placed the key into a tall lantern at the center of the forest. Immediately, all the lanterns lit up in dazzling colors, filling the world with joy and laughter again.

The animals cheered, and Pip thanked her warmly. <name> felt proud for helping and happy to have made a new friend. When she returned home, she tucked the memory close to her heart, knowing that kindness and courage could brighten any place—just like the rainbow lights.
